Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
SimpleBoard is the main class that controls the game state. It stores the board grid, the current falling brick, the next upcoming bricks,and handles movement, rotation, row clearing and score updates. This class is used by GameController to update the game and by GuiController to draw everything on screen.

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleBoard

      public SimpleBoard(int width, int height)
      Creates a new game board with the given width and height. A fresh Score object is created and the board is completely empty.
      Parameters:
      width - number of rows in the board
      height - number of columns in the board

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      public boolean moveBrickDown()
      Moves the active brick down by one row. If the brick cannot move down this method returns false so the controller knows it must merge the brick.
      Specified by:
      moveBrickDown in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false if blocked

    • moveBrickLeft

      public boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Moves the active brick left
      Specified by:
      moveBrickLeft in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if movement is allowed, false otherwise

    • moveBrickRight

      Moves the active brick right
      Specified by:
      moveBrickRight in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if movement is allowed, false otherwise

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the current brick. A simple wall kick, if rotation is blocked, the game tries shifting 1 step left or right to make it fit.
      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if rotation succeeds, false if no rotation is possible

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates the next falling brick, taken from the queue. Always ensures that there are 3 upcoming bricks in the queue. Also sets the starting position of the new brick.
      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the new brick immediately collides (game over)

    • getBoardMatrix

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Returns the full game matrix including background blocks.
      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      board grid as a 2D array

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Returns the current brick shape and its position. GuiController uses this to draw the falling brick.
      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      a ViewData object containing brick info

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      public void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Copies the falling brick into the background matrix, making it part of the board permanently.
      Specified by:
      mergeBrickToBackground in interface Board

    • clearRows

      public ClearRow clearRows()

      Specified by:
      clearRows in interface Board
      Returns:
